alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 4:37PM EDT by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN CHAUTAUQUA COUNTY THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 434 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Findley Lake, or 15 miles east of Erie, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding is possible in areas of low lying and poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Clymer, Findley Lake, Long Point State Park, Mina, French Creek, Sherman, Panama, Bemus Point, Stedman Corners, Niobe, Stow, Ellery Center, and Ashville. This includes Interstate 86 between exits 4 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
